headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Object type. Use this field to specify whether you want to update the negative keywords for a campaign or ad group. Enum values: CAMPAIGN : campaign. ADGROUP : ad group.

parameters.name: object_id
parameters.description: Object ID. Object ID. Use this field to pass in a campaign ID or ad group ID that you want to update the negative keyword for. Specify this field according to object_type : If object_type is CAMPAIGN , assign to this field a campaign ID. If object_type is ADGROUP , assign to this field an ad group ID.

parameters.name: old_keyword_id
parameters.description: The ID of the negative keyword that you want to update. To obtain the ID of a negative keyword, use /search_ad/negative_word/get/ . Note : If the negative keyword ID that you specify does not exist, an error will occur.

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: Information about the update to the original keyword.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name for the negative keyword you specify via old_keyword_id . Length limit: no more than 80 characters. The name needs to exclude the following special characters: [ ! , @ , % , ^ , ( , ) , = , { , } , ; , ~ , ` , < , > , ? , \ , | ]. Otherwise, an error will occur. Note : Duplicate negative keyword names will be de-duplicated to only one unique name, and for each unique name you can only specify one match type. However, if you want to update the match type of a negative keyword, you can pass in the same name via name and assign a different match type via match_type .

parameters.name: match_type
parameters.description: Match type for the negative keyword. Enum values: PRECISE_WORD : exact match. PHRASE_WORD : phrase match. BROAD_WORD : broad match. Default value: BROAD_WORD .

examples.title: Example - Update the name of a negative keyword
Example - Update the match type of a negative keyword
